summary: The 'Bring Entrepreneurial Advancements To Consumers Here In North America Act' (H.R. 2652) proposes tax incentives to encourage manufacturers to relocate from foreign countries to the United States.  It includes accelerated depreciation for qualified nonresidential real property, exclusion of gain on the disposition of property related to relocation, and permanent full expensing for qualified property. These changes primarily impact the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, aiming to boost domestic manufacturing and investment.
